item.title: Some Useful Server Fixes your Server Needs
item.dc:creator: @RunesGAYpe RunesGAYpe
item.description:
@RunesGAYpe wrote:

For the last part of the tut you could just as easily have put savechar(); inside of your process void so that its called on every 500ms and the character will never be reset more than 500ms.

That’s how I did it and it dosent lag the server at all I have savechar and savemoreinfo under my process lol

Read full topic
item.source: Some Useful Server Fixes your Server Needs

item.title: Some Useful Server Fixes your Server Needs
item.dc:creator: @QuestMaster_2K10 QuestMaster 2K10
item.description:
@QuestMaster_2K10 wrote:

[quote=“C4ll3r, post:3, topic:325858”][code]PlayerHandler.java:156: cannot find symbol
symbol: class Client
{ for (int i = 0; i < maxPlayers; i+
if(players[i] != null)
((Client)players[i]).savegame(false); }
});

              ^

1 error
Finished Building Class Files…![/code]

Ok, Thanks for fucking up my server …

[code]Usage: java [-options] class [args…]
(to execute a class)
or java [-options] -jar jarfile [args…]
(to execute a jar file)

where options include:
-client to select the “client” VM
-server to select the “server” VM
-hotspot is a synonym for the “client” VM [deprecated]
The default VM is client.

-cp <class search path of directories and zip/jar files>
-classpath <class search path of directories and zip/jar files>
              A ; separated list of directories, JAR archives,
              and ZIP archives to search for class files.
-D<name>=<value>
              set a system property
-verbose[:class|gc|jni]
              enable verbose output
-version      print product version and exit
-version:<value>
              require the specified version to run
-showversion  print product version and continue
-jre-restrict-search | -jre-no-restrict-search
              include/exclude user private JREs in the version search
-? -help      print this help message
-X            print help on non-standard options
-ea[:<packagename>...|:<classname>]
-enableassertions[:<packagename>...|:<classname>]
              enable assertions
-da[:<packagename>...|:<classname>]
-disableassertions[:<packagename>...|:<classname>]
              disable assertions
-esa | -enablesystemassertions
              enable system assertions
-dsa | -disablesystemassertions
              disable system assertions
-agentlib:<libname>[=<options>]
              load native agent library <libname>, e.g. -agentlib:hprof
                see also, -agentlib:jdwp=help and -agentlib:hprof=help
-agentpath:<pathname>[=<options>]
              load native agent library by full pathname
-javaagent:<jarpath>[=<options>]
              load Java programming language agent, see java.lang.instrument

-splash:<imagepath>
              show splash screen with specified image

server wordt niet herkend als een interne
of externe opdracht, programma of batchbestand.
Druk op een toets om door te gaan. . .[/code][/quote]

He didn’t “fuck” up your server, if you new java programming you would easily of fixed the error.

BTW, nice job Lin.

Read full topic
item.source: Some Useful Server Fixes your Server Needs

item.source: Some Useful Server Fixes your Server Needs

item.title: Some Useful Server Fixes your Server Needs
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“stepehi, post:23, topic:325858”]by adding “Fixing the “null” printing in the console, which also prevents the server from crashing over time”, it will cause disconnecting when you add friends.[/quote]Uhm… No it won’t. The code I have fixes the list populating, and it just checks if what it’s using isn’t a null. If it is, then it skips that friend.

[quote=“runefreak10, post:22, topic:325858”]To the part where you said to add savegame(false);to wherever disconnected = true; appears, wouldn’t it make more sense to back-trace where the disconnected method is and all of the code that makes it work and just add savegame(false); in that code so whenever disconnected = true, it’ll just call the savegame(false) method?[/quote]You know, I don’t believe I thought of that. I guess so, but it also could be bad in some cases. But sure, that seems like a better idea.

Read full topic

item.title: Some Useful Server Fixes your Server Needs
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

To the part where you said to add savegame(false);to wherever disconnected = true; appears, wouldn’t it make more sense to back-trace where the disconnected method is and all of the code that makes it work and just add savegame(false); in that code so whenever disconnected = true, it’ll just call the savegame(false) method?

Read full topic

item.title: Some Useful Server Fixes your Server Needs
item.dc:creator: @The_Chubby_Bunny The Chubby Bunny
item.description:
@The_Chubby_Bunny wrote:

@Feel No Pain

You don’t have to worry about your .class files, your compiler just builds your .java files into something that can be executed (a.k.a .class files).

Read full topic

item.title: Some Useful Server Fixes your Server Needs
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Sorry, I forgot to make the Client a lowercase c, as I’m used to all classes having a capital letter as does mine. Just change the cast to (client).

As for your batch errors, my tutorial did nothing to that. Make sure inside your batch file, you still have this: java server.

Read full topic
item.source: Some Useful Server Fixes your Server Needs
